pros: The people are amazing and super intelligent. You learn every day through the evolving climate crisis.
cons: Comms are samey with little room / budget to do exciting things. Progression can also be unclear.

review_title: Great organisation with a great mission and motivated staff
pros: Good culture, flexible working, great mission
cons: Not very good benefits, few outdated systems, a bit of siloed working

review_title: A great environment to be working in!
pros:
I have been working at ClientEarth for over 3 years now and have witnessed the organisation undergo a major positive transformation over this time. I really enjoy working here as I've got a very supportive manager and colleagues, and everyone in the organisation is just so dedicated to their work, plus they're genuinely nice people to work with!

It is also motivating to be part of ClientEarth at this time as it's undergoing an exciting period of growth in response to growing support of our impactful programme work. I can see that a lot of effort has been put in place recently to strengthen the senior management leadership to steer the organisational expansion more efficiently.
cons: At times the organisation struggled to keep up with the rapid growth which meant that our team was over-stretched for some time. But this has now been addressed and we've got additional resources on the team to do our job.

pros: Incredible work being carried out on the ground to help save the environment
cons: Very top down and quite a toxic environment to work in. Staff here work very long hours and are not rewarded for their commitment to their job or the cause. Lots of serious issues at senior management level which seep into the rest of the organisation and make it a negative experience.

pros: The team working there are working towards a great cause with some good members.
cons: ashame that some of the management are not very supportive or friendly to there staff.

pros: Nice colleagues, great mission, lots of opportunities to work on different projects
cons: Lack of opportunities to progress in your role
not an option for progression to higher management
